de.polygonal.ds.SLL<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A singly linked list.

See http://lab.polygonal.de/?p=206

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(?reservedSize : Int, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
reservedSize if > 0, this list maintains an object pool of node objects.
Prevents frequent node allocation and thus increases performance at the cost of using more memory.
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this list.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError reserved size is greater than allowed size (debug only).

Instance Variables

head : SLLNode<T>

The head of this list or null if this list is empty.

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this list.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

tail : SLLNode<T>

The tail of this list or null if this list is empty.

Instance Methods

inline append(x : T) : SLLNode<T>

returns
the appended node storing x.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Appends the element x to the tail of this list by creating a SLLNode object storing x. 1

inline appendNode(x : SLLNode<T>) : Void

Appends the node x to this list. 1

assign(C : Class<T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
C the class to instantiate for each element.
args passes additional constructor arguments to C.
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with objects of type C. n

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, nodes, pointers and elements are nullified upon removal.
Removes all elements. 1 or n if purge is true

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this linked list. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

close() : Void

Makes this list circular by connecting the tail to the head.
Silently fails if this list is already closed. 1

concat(x : SLL<T>) : SLL<T>

returns
a new list containing the elements of both lists.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x is null or this equals x (debug only).
Concatenates this list with the list x by appending all elements of x to this list.
This list and x are untouched. n

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this list contains a node storing the element x. n

inline createNode(x : T) : SLLNode<T>

Creates and returns a new SLLNode object storing the value x and pointing to this list. 1

fill(x : T, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with the instance of x. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all nodes, pointers and data for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline getNodeAt(i : Int) : SLLNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError list is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the node at "index" i.
The index is measured relative to the head node (= index 0). n

inline insertAfter(node : SLLNode<T>, x : T) : SLLNode<T>

returns
the inserted node storing x.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError node is null or not managed by this list (debug only).
Inserts the element x after node by creating a SLLNode object storing x. 1

inline insertBefore(node : SLLNode<T>, x : T) : SLLNode<T>

returns
the inserted node storing x.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError node is null or not managed by this list (debug only).
Inserts the element x before node by creating a SLLNode object storing x. 1

isCircular() : Bool

Returns true if this list is circular.
A list is circular if the tail points to the head. 1

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this list is empty. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new SLLIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this singly linked list.
The elements are visited from head to tail.
If performance is crucial, use the following loop instead:
	  var node = mySLL.head;
	  while (node != null)
	  {
	      var element = node.val;
	      node = node.next;
	  }

join(x : String) : String

Converts the data in the linked list to strings, inserts x between the elements, concatenates them, and returns the resulting string. n

merge(x : SLL<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x is null or this list equals x (debug only).
Merges this list with the list x by linking both lists together.
The merge operation destroys x so it should be discarded. n

nodeOf(x : T, ?from : SLLNode<T>) : SLLNode<T>

returns
the node containing x or null if such a node does not exist.
If from is null, the search starts at the head of this list.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError from is not managed by this list (debug only).
Searches for the element x in this list from head to tail starting at node from. n

open() : Void

Makes this list non-circular by disconnecting the tail from the head and vice versa.
Silently fails if this list is already non-circular. 1

inline popDown() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError list is empty (debug only).
Unlinks the tail node and prepends it to the head. n

inline prepend(x : T) : SLLNode<T>

returns
the prepended node storing x.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Prepends the element x to the head of this list by creating a SLLNode object storing x. 1

prependNode(x : SLLNode<T>) : Void

Prepends the node x to this list. 1

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x was removed.
Removes all nodes storing the element x. n

inline removeHead() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError list is empty (debug only).
Removes the head node and returns the element stored in this node. 1

inline removeTail() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError list is empty (debug only).
Removes the tail node and returns the element stored in this node. n

reverse() : Void

Reverses the linked list in place. n

inline shiftUp() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError list is empty (debug only).
Unlinks the head node and appends it to the tail. 1

shuffle(?rval : DA<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of this collection by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.
n

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements. 1

sort(compare : T -> T -> Int, ?useInsertionSort : Bool) : Void

parameters
compare a comparison function.
If null, the elements are compared using element.compare().
In this case all elements have to implement Comparable.
useInsertionSort if true, the linked list is sorted using the insertion sort algorithm. This is faster for nearly sorted lists.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element does not implement Comparable (debug only).
Sorts the elements of this list using the merge sort algorithm. n log n for merge sort and n² for insertion sort

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in this singly linked list.
The elements are ordered head-to-tail.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in this singly linked list.
The elements are ordered head-to-tail.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var list = new de.polygonal.ds.SLL<Int>();
	  for (i in 0...4) {
	      list.append(i);
	  }
	  trace(list);
	  {SLL, size: 4}
 	  |< head
	    0
	    1
	    2
	    3
	  tail >|

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a vector.<T> objec containing all elements in this singly linked list.
The elements are ordered head-to-tail.

inline unlink(node : SLLNode<T>) : SLLNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError list is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError node is null or not managed by this list (debug only).
Unlinks node from this list and returns node.next;. n
